SEARCH

Class AddContact

java.lang.Object
AddContact
public class AddContact extends Object
A subordinate class to the Main-class of the Finnish Contacts Application. This class contains the necessary methods for adding a new contact to the CSV-file.
Author:
Joel Laitinen

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    AddContact()
     

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    static void
    addAnother()
    This method asks the user if they'd like to immediately add another contact by pressing 1, which loops back to the addContact()-method, or if they'd like to do something else by pressing 2, which calls the pickOption()-method in the primary Main-class.
    static void

    This method constructs an ArrayList consisting of the personal ID, first and last names, phone number, and optionally the address and e-mail submitted by the user.

  • Constructor Details

    • AddContact

      public AddContact()

  • Method Details

    • addContact

      public static void addContact()
      This method constructs an ArrayList consisting of the personal ID, first and last names, phone number, and optionally the address and e-mail submitted by the user. Each element in the ArrayList calls a separate method, and at the end they are all written at the end of the CSV-file, the contents of which are obtained from the DisplayContacts-class.

    • personalID

      public static String personalID()
      This method asks the user to provide an ID. It individually checks through each character whether they correspond to the formula for creating and ID. If something doesn't, the method asks the user to provide another ID.
      Returns:
      the ID submitted by the user.

    • name

      public static String name()
      This method asks the user to provide a name, first or last. The name cannot contain numbers or special characters. If it does, the name is not accepted and the method asks the user to provide another one.
      Returns:
      the name submitted by the user.

    • phoneNumber

      public static String phoneNumber()
      This method asks the user to provide a phone number. The number must correspond to the rules of Finnish mobile numbers. If it doesn't, the program asks the user to provide another one.
      Returns:
      the phone number submitted by the user.

    • address

      public static String address()
      This method asks the user to separately provide a street name, house number, apartment number (optional), postal code, and city name. Each element is added together into a String which the method then returns. However, this method is completely optional as the program doesn't require the user to provide an address if they don't want to, so this method can be skipped by pressing ENTER at the start when it asks for a street name.
      Returns:
      the address submitted by the user.

    • email

      public static String email()
      This method asks the user for an e-mail address. However, this method is completely optional, as the program doesn't require the user to provide an e-mail address if they don't want to, so it is possible to skip this method by pressing ENTER.
      Returns:
      the e-mail submitted by the user.

    • addAnother

      public static void addAnother()
      This method asks the user if they'd like to immediately add another contact by pressing 1, which loops back to the addContact()-method, or if they'd like to do something else by pressing 2, which calls the pickOption()-method in the primary Main-class.
